About

     Hi, my name is Cheng Gu. I am a sophomore at Woodbury University, majoring Applied Computer Science. Anticipates graduating in 2020 with a Bachelor’s Degree in Applied Computer Science.


     I didn't start programming very early, but I love 3D game programming, and have a strong passion of learning Computer Graphics!

Suzuka Wants to Fly (Compatible with VR) -using Unity3Dmore_vert

Github

close

In this Project, I focus on creating a third person controller system for my first anime character, with Swinging, Fly-Bursiting, wallwalking, and battle machanics. I also create a infinity City Generator to help me create a world easily.


Read more!

Using the versatility of projection mapping and the depth of infinity mirrors to show a piece that would inspire curiosity about the wonders, beauty, and unknowns that lie deep beneath the surface of what the human eye can perceive; the deep sea.

Spells and EXP

  • "Good knowledge of Unity Game Engine, such as UGUI, Mecanim Animation, Particle System, and Unity API. "

  • "Be skilled in C# programming in Unity; Good knowledge in object-oriented programming. "

  • "Have a variety of programming experience, such as C++ with Unreal Game Engine; Python with Blender; Javascript with P5.js, Node.js, and Amazon Web Service; HTC Vive Virtual Reality with Unity Game Engine; TouchDesigner. "

  • "Be familiar with using 3D creation suite, such as Blender and Maya. "

  • "Have a solid mathematical foundation. Currently working as a Math Tutor at Woodbury University. "

  • "Strong sense of responsibility and enthusiasm for learning. "

  • "Having a 3.7 GPA so far. "

  • "Spring 2018, nominated for Woodbury University Writing Department Award by Professor Laurel DiGangi. "
